crepererum commented on issue #4504: ARROW-5525: [C++] WIP: Continuous Fuzzing Integration with Fuzzit
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4504#issuecomment-500746566
 
 
   FYI: I'll work together w/ @yevgenypats to address the following issues:
   
   - **fuzzer binaries should be statically linked:** this will simplify the work for Fuzzit and other continuous fuzzing services
   - **accesss clarification:** since the fuzzing results (crashes) may contain security-sensitive information, we should think if these are publicly available or if only arrow maintainers should see them
   - **corpus:** fuzzing w/o a proper seed corpus is kinda wasteful. we should have a corpus that containers
     - previous found and fixed crashes
     - some valid arrow messages (simple and complex ones), I think the integration test files will work here
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.

users@infra.apache.org

crepererum commented on issue #4504: ARROW-5525: [C++] WIP: Continuous Fuzzing Integration with Fuzzit
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4504#issuecomment-502165821
 
 
   ## Static Linking
   The binary is statically linked against the arrow code, but dynamically linked against the system libs. We cannot completely remove this restrictions [due to address sanitizer](https://clang.llvm.org/docs/AddressSanitizer.html#limitations), but we can try to limit the host-library interaction:
   
   ```bash
   cmake \
       -DARROW_FUZZING=ON \
       -DARROW_USE_ASAN=ON \
       -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=RelWithDebInfo \
       -DARROW_DEPENDENCY_SOURCE=BUNDLED \
       ..
   ```
   
   With this, I have the following libs left:
   
   ```text
   /lib64/ld-linux-x86-64.so.2
   libboost_filesystem.so.1.69.0
   libboost_regex.so.1.69.0
   libboost_system.so.1.69.0
   libc.so.6
   libcrypto.so.1.1
   libdl.so.2
   libgcc_s.so.1
   libicudata.so.64
   libicui18n.so.64
   libicuuc.so.64
   libm.so.6
   libpthread.so.0
   librt.so.1
   libstdc++.so.6
   linux-vdso.so.1
   ```
   
   Sadly, I wasn't able to build arrow with a vendored boost. And I think the sanitizer library will also be loaded at runtime.
   
   ## Corpus
   Is now hosted under https://github.com/apache/arrow-testing/tree/master/data/arrow-ipc. I'll try to extend this in the coming week(s).
   
   ## Known Bugs
   I currently have some bugs that I have discovered already by fuzzing locally and that I'm trying to fix them. This shouldn't prevent anyone from running a fuzzer, but be warned that you may run into them rather quickly.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.

yevgenypats commented on issue #4504: ARROW-5525: [C++] WIP: Continuous Fuzzing Integration with Fuzzit
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4504#issuecomment-503527887
 
 
   @crepererum The pull-request is almost ready but I need a bit of help on your end.
    
   As you said it's already found a crash. I added you to the [apache/arrow](https://app.fuzzit.dev/admin/yMxZh42xl9qy6bvg3EiJ/dashboard) organization so you can take a look.
   
   Currently the Fuzzit integration is configured to run on every PR and commit which is too much and might just spam your inbox because of PRs that are not ready yet.
   
   My suggestion is to create a cron job in travis and run this step on a daily basis from master - kind like done in [systemd](https://github.com/systemd/systemd/blob/master/.travis.yml).
   
   Let me know what you think.
   
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

wesm commented on issue #4504: ARROW-5525: [C++] WIP: Continuous Fuzzing Integration with Fuzzit
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4504#issuecomment-504073241
 
 
   Take a look at jobs in 
   
   https://github.com/apache/arrow/blob/master/docker-compose.yml
   
   An example is `iwyu` which uses the clang toolchain to build and run include-what-you-use
   
   To add a nightly job, add an entry to https://github.com/apache/arrow/blob/master/dev/tasks/tests.yml#L21
   
   Here is an example of a Travis CI configuration that can be used to set up a nightly cron job
   
   https://github.com/apache/arrow/blob/master/dev/tasks/nightlies.sample.yml
   
   Here's an example of a nightly run https://github.com/ursa-labs/crossbow/branches/all?page=1&query=nightly-481&utf8=%E2%9C%93
   
   @kszucs is working to better document some of these things cc @nealrichardson

crepererum commented on issue #4504: ARROW-5525: [C++] WIP: Continuous Fuzzing Integration with Fuzzit
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4504#issuecomment-504910555
 
 
   No, that build system setup is new to me (but I never actually modified the arrow build infrastructure before). I would say:
   
   1. Create a `fuzzing` folder in https://github.com/apache/arrow/tree/master/dev/tasks
   2. Take the [`nightlies.sample.yml`](https://github.com/apache/arrow/blob/master/dev/tasks/nightlies.sample.yml) template and merge it with your `.travis.yml` modifications and store it in the mentioned `fuzzing` folder.
   3. Add the job [here](https://github.com/apache/arrow/blob/master/dev/tasks/tests.yml#L21) and [here](https://github.com/apache/arrow/blob/master/dev/tasks/tasks.yml#L57).

issuetype.description: A new unit, integration or system test.
issuetype.name: Test

fields.description:
Since fuzzing kinda only works if done as a continuous background job, we should find a way of doing so. This likely requires another service than Travis. Basic requirements are:
 * master builds should be submitted for fuzzing
 * project members should be informed about new crashes (ideally not via public issue due to potential security impact)

comments.body:
[~yevgenyp] Can you explain how one can view the fuzzing jobs? I submitted a build from my local machine but don't know where to view it (I'm using the hardcoded API key):
{code:java}
2019/09/17 14:20:01 Creating job...
2019/09/17 14:20:02 Uploading fuzzer...
2019/09/17 14:20:39 Starting job
2019/09/17 14:20:39 Job aQbIQe0y2n4LX0iKYjnd started succesfully
2019/09/17 14:20:39 Job created successfully
{code}

There's [https://fuzzit.dev/] where you can login via GitHub, but I think your account must be linked to the {{apache/arrow}} organization (on Fuzzit, not on GitHub). That (to my understanding) must be done by the Fuzzit support team ([~yevgenyp] ?).

[~pitrou] I've added you as admin to apache arrow organisation [https://app.fuzzit.dev/orgs/yMxZh42xl9qy6bvg3EiJ/dashboard].

[~marco.neumann.by] you are admin in the organisation.

 

As far as I remember the fuzzing was a bit stalled as the arrow-ipc-fuzzing target was crashing constantly and it wasn't fix so it doesn't really accumulate any interesting corpus.

Also a lot was changed since we first integrated apache-arrow so if fuzzing is a again a priority I would love to help - transfer apache/arrow to new organisation (the old one was deprecated.) and update the Fuzzit CLI to latest version.

 

Also [~pitrou] you can join our slack at [https://slack.fuzzit.dev|https://slack.fuzzit.dev/] and DM so I can help you set it up.
[~marco.neumann.by] ok, cool. I'll open a PR with an update. and I'll transfer you organisation to a new one.
